commodities.tests.technical
Class TechnicalTestAbstract.GraphPanelAbstract

java.lang.Object
  commodities.tests.technical.TechnicalTestAbstract.GraphPanelAbstract
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventListener, GraphRedrawListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
TechnicalTestAbstract.BarGraphPanelAbstract, TechnicalTestAbstract.ContinuousLineGraphPanelAbstract, TechnicalTestAbstract.SegmentLineGraphPanelAbstract, TechnicalTestAbstract.TrendlineGraphPanelAbstract
Enclosing class:
TechnicalTestAbstract
protected abstract class TechnicalTestAbstract.GraphPanelAbstract
extends Object
implements GraphRedrawListener

GraphPanelAbstract provides an abstract class for drawing graphs and supplying default methods for the GraphRedrawListener.

Version:
1.0
Author:
J.R. Titko
Updated:
2004.11.11

Method Detail

getYBuffer

public double getYBuffer()
Gets the number of pixels that should be added as white space to the top and bottom of the graph when calculating the scale of the graph. This value is inside the graph's frame and therefore reduces the amount of drawing space by twice its amount.

Specified by:
getYBuffer in interface GraphRedrawListener
Returns:
The number of pixels to use at the top and bottom of the graph.

getMaxValue

public double getMaxValue()
Gets the maximum value represented in the graph.

Specified by:
getMaxValue in interface GraphRedrawListener
Returns:
The data's maximum value.

getMinValue

public double getMinValue()
Gets the minimum value represented in the graph.

Specified by:
getMinValue in interface GraphRedrawListener
Returns:
The data's minimum value.

getTickSize

public double getTickSize()
Gets the size of a tick for the commodity being drawn. This keeps the scale of the graph in multiples of this tick size.

Specified by:
getTickSize in interface GraphRedrawListener
Returns:
The data's tick size.

redrawTitle

public boolean redrawTitle(Graphics g,
                           int yOffset)
Draws the title of the graph at the top of the graph offset by the other graph titles that are alread there.

Specified by:
redrawTitle in interface GraphRedrawListener
Parameters:
g - The graphics area to draw in.
yOffset - The y-axis offset the title should have.
Returns:
always returns true

redrawComponent

public void redrawComponent(GraphRedrawEvent e)
Sets up the drawing space, scale, and then draws the graph.

Specified by:
redrawComponent in interface GraphRedrawListener
Parameters:
e - the event containing the graph to draw into

redrawGraph

public void redrawGraph(Graphics g,
                        StatsAbstract stats,
                        int xAxisLeft,
                        int xAxisRight,
                        int yAxisBottom,
                        double minValue,
                        int xScale,
                        double yScale)
Aligns the right hand side of the graph to the next monday and then draws the graph.

Parameters:
g - the graphics area to draw in
stats - the statistics to be draw
xAxisLeft - the possision of the left side of the graph
xAxisRight - the possision of the right side of the graph
yAxisBottom - the possision of the bottom side of the graph
minValue - the minimum value to be graphed
xScale - the horizontal scale the graph is to be drawn in
yScale - the vertical scale the graph is to be drawn in

drawGraph

public abstract void drawGraph(Graphics g,
                               StatsAbstract stats,
                               CommodityCalendar calendar,
                               int xAxisLeft,
                               int xAxisRight,
                               int yAxisBottom,
                               double minValue,
                               int xScale,
                               double yScale)
Draw the graph itself.

Parameters:
g - the graphics area to draw in
stats - the statistics to be drawn
calendar - the calendar to be used to process the graph starting on a monday
xAxisLeft - the position of the left side of the graph
xAxisRight - the position of the right side of the graph
yAxisBottom - the position of the bottom side of the graph
minValue - the minimum value to be graphed
xScale - the horizontal scale the graph is to be drawn in
yScale - the vertical scale the graph is to be drawn in

removeListeners

public void removeListeners()
Remove all listeners.
